result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon T. VICE was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Under the Huber Law, consecutive to any other sentences presently being served.
Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon T. VICE

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant in custody.
NO CONTEST plea entered to the charge of escape.  Convicted.
The defendant is sentenced to the Manitowoc County Jail for sixty (60) days, under the Huber Law, to run consecutive to any other sentences presently being served.
Court costs are waived.
Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Minutes.

Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection. 
Cover Letter.

Defendant in custody.  
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 3 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 03-28-14 at 11:00 a.m.  Plea date is set for 05-01-14 at 11:30 a.m.  State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.   
Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing is set for 03-11-14 at 2:30 p.m.  
Minutes.

Defendant in custody.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of escape.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 03-10-14 at 2:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that he report to the Manitowoc City Police Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours of release and that he have no contact with Thomas Riley, Jr.   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
